caption.p: Fitting functions tested for describing axial displacement. Equations are used in Figure 4—figure supplement 2. L: length; t: time. Other parameters and their meaning are listed in the table. For all axial coordinates in this paper, a three-parameter logistic function was used.

tr.td: A: upper asymptotic length B: growth rate C: time at which L = 0
A: upper asymptotic length B: lower asymptotic length C: growth rate
A: upper asymptotic length B: growth rate C: time at which L = 0
A: upper asymptotic length B: growth rate C: inflection point
A: upper asymptotic length B: length at t = 0 C: growth rate D: inflection parameter
A: upper asymptotic length B: lower asymptotic length C: growth rate D: steepness parameter
